title: 113_s643
content: The Act titled "Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2013" aims to enhance cost savings. The Act "Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2013" amends Section 4512 of title 5, United States Code to include the identification of surplus funds or unnecessary budget authority. The Inspector General or designated agency employee must refer any identified surplus funds or unnecessary budget authority to the Chief Financial Officer of the agency along with recommendations. The Act "Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2013" requires the Chief Financial Officer of an agency to transfer surplus funds or unnecessary budget authority identified by an employee to the general fund of the Treasury for deficit reduction. Transfers under this provision are not subject to the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974. The Act "Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2013" mandates the transfer of surplus funds or unnecessary budget authority identified by an employee to the Treasury for deficit reduction. The head of an agency can retain up to 10% of the transferred amounts for cash awards to employees who identify such funds. Additionally, agencies must report instances of fraud, waste, or surplus funds identified by employees to the Office of Personnel Management annually. The Act mandates the identification of surplus funds or unnecessary budget authority by agency employees, with savings reported in budget requests. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management submits an annual report on Federal cost savings and awards based on these disclosures. The Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2013 requires agencies to report cost savings and awards annually to Congress and the Government Accountability Office. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management ensures compliance with cash award programs and submits certifications to Congress. The Comptroller General submits a report every 3 years on the program's operation and may suggest legislative changes. Officers are eligible for cash awards under Section 4509 of title 5, United States. Section 4509 of title 5, United States Code prohibits cash awards to certain officers, including those at level I of the Executive Schedule, agency heads, and members of independent establishments. The table of sections for chapter 45 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 4509 and inserting a new entry. Prohibition of cash award to certain officers.
